exercise.shortdescription: Create a TCP echo client and server using Python.
exercise.description: Create a TCP echo client and server using Python.
exercise.tutorial:
On your defensive workstation, create a tcp echo client and server using Python. Only the client should display output to the console.

A TCP echo client is a program that opens a socket, binds it's address to localhost, and sends a message to a server. It then receives that same message back from the server.

A TCP echo server is a program that creates a socket, binds to an address, and echos back the message received from the client.

 

For Help: email your code to the Adelphi Training Team at adelphi-training-team@googlegroups.com for code review.

Python is available for install in the share drive, if it is not already installed on your workstation.
